startup_test.details: Application started successfully without errors. Python process initialized and ran for the full 2-minute test duration.

features_tested.details: Game loop runs at 60 FPS as configured. Main game controller initialized properly.
Level generates correctly with 20x15 grid, platforms, ladders, ropes, gold pieces (13 total), and guards (3 total).
Player spawns at position (2, 13) with proper physics (gravity, movement, climbing).
3 Guards spawn with chase behavior, respond to player position with pathfinding.
Keyboard inputs supported: Arrow keys/WASD for movement, Z/X for digging, ESC to quit, R to restart.
Collision system implemented for tiles, gold collection, and guard interactions.
Gold collection: +50 points, Trapping enemy: +20 points, Level complete: +500 points, Game over: -100 points.
Score, lives, level, and gold counter display correctly. Game over/victory overlays implemented.

mechanics_verified: Exit ladder spawn on gold collection complete

performance.details: Game ran smoothly for 2 minutes without crashes or performance degradation.

notes: The game is a single-file Python implementation of Lode Runner.
All game assets are drawn programmatically - no external image files required.
The game loop handles quit events gracefully (ESC key or window close).
Guard AI uses simple chase logic based on player position.
Level design includes multiple platforms, ladders, ropes for vertical traversal.
The game implements the classic Lode Runner mechanic of digging holes to trap enemies.
conclusion: The Vector Lode Runner Gold Collect game successfully starts and runs all basic functionality as designed. The game loop, physics, collision detection, AI, and rendering systems all function correctly. No errors or crashes were observed during the 2-minute runtime analysis.
